subject: Re: [junit] Private method throws an exception

messageBody:
Elliotte Harold wrote:
> mitchellch60 wrote:
> > My method under test calls a private method in the same class. The
> > private method throws an exception preventing me for completing my
> > unit test.
> >
>
> The test is failing. That means your code is broken (or just maybe the
> test is broken instead). Either way, fix the breakage, wherever it lies.
> Some of the other suggestions you've gotten here are actively harmful
> and won't solve your problem (Making the private method public? Bleah.)

I understand you don't believe in polluting the public API, but saying
that that suggestion won't solve the problem is ridiculous.

1. Make the method public.
2. Test it.
3. Now that it's covered by tests, refactor until you reach a design
where such an implementation detail either doesn't have to be public or
makes sense to be public. If needed, hide it behind an interface.

How doesn't that solve his problem?
